title: Sampled Softmax / Log-Uniform Sampler - Google Billion Word Language Model
body_html:
I implemented the Sampled Softmax and Log-Uniform Sampler ops for PyTorch.

I tested my implementation on the Google Billion Word dataset.
52.68 Perplexity after 10 training epochs on a 4-layer, 512-unit LSTM Language Model
https://github.com/rdspring1/PyTorch_LM

The Multinomial Sampler without replacement was extremely slow, so I prototyped the Log-Uniform Sampler in Cython.

Is this something worth adding to PyTorch?

body:
I implemented the [Sampled Softmax](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/sampled_softmax_loss) and [Log-Uniform Sampler](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/cc/class/tensorflow/ops/log-uniform-candidate-sampler) ops for PyTorch.

I tested my implementation on the Google Billion Word dataset.
52.68 Perplexity after 10 training epochs on a 4-layer, 512-unit LSTM Language Model
https://github.com/rdspring1/PyTorch_LM

The [Multinomial Sampler](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html?highlight=multinomial#torch.multinomial) without replacement was extremely slow, so I prototyped the Log-Uniform Sampler in Cython.

Is this something worth adding to PyTorch?
